intro: Lechea cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in umbels and range in color from white to pink. Lechea cubensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
